intro: Physaliastrum japonicum, commonly known as Japanese false indigo, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. Physaliastrum japonicum prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
